data.system_settings: Samsung Galaxy S7 edge, Android Nougat 7.0
data.actual_result: You get a toast message saying: "A bad network request has occurred, please try again"
data.expected_result: You should get a red error message saying "Vanity URL could not be changed because ..." like on the desktop version. You actually get this message on Android when trying to pick a URL that's already in use or one that contains invalid characters, but not when it contains a blacklisted word.
data.short_description: Wrong error message when trying to set a vanity URL that contains a blacklisted word
data.steps_to_repro: - Have permissions to change the Vanity URL of a partner server - Go Server Settings > Vanity URL - Enter a URL that contains a blacklisted word, try something that contains "discord" (probably the only blacklisted word at the time of writing) - Hit Enter and notice that you get a toast message saying: "A bad network request has occurred, please try again"
